Function Documentation

void EagleLogger_Delete ( EagleLogger *  logger  ) 

Delete a logger.

Note:
Do not call this function unless you have a good reason. Once the logger is created it will be reused automatically.
Parameters:
[in] logger The logger to free.

EagleLogger* EagleLogger_Get ( void   ) 

Get the default logger.

If the default logged has not been initialised it will be initialised automatically and returned.

Definition at line 47 of file EagleLogger.c.

00051     
00052     /* this function must be synchronized */
00053     if(NULL == lock) {
00054         lock = EagleSynchronizer_CreateLock();
00055     }
00056     EagleSynchronizer_Lock(lock);
00057     
00058     /* initialise if its not started */
00059     if(NULL == EagleLogger_Logger) {
00060         EagleLogger_Logger = EagleLogger_New(stderr);
00061     }
00062

void EagleLogger_logEvent ( EagleLogger *  logger,
EagleLoggerEvent *  event

Definition at line 79 of file EagleLogger.c.

00080 {
00081     char *timestamp;
00082     
00083     if(NULL == logger) {
00084         return;
00085     }
00086     if(NULL == event) {
00087         return;
00088     }
00089     
00090     /* this function must be synchronized */
00091     EagleSynchronizer_Lock(logger->logLock);
00092     
00093     /* pretty time */
00094     timestamp = ctime(&event->when);
00095     timestamp[strlen(timestamp) - 1] = '\0';
00096     
00097     if(NULL != logger->out) {
00098         fprintf(logger->out, "%s: [%s] %s\n", timestamp, EagleLoggerSeverity_toString(event->severity), event->message);
00099     }
00100     ++logger->totalMessages;
00101     
00102     /* track most recent event */
00103     if(NULL != logger->lastEvent) {
00104         EagleLoggerEvent_Delete(logger->lastEvent);
00105     }
00106     logger->lastEvent = event;
00107     
00108     EagleSynchronizer_Unlock(logger->logLock);
00109 }

EagleLogger* EagleLogger_New ( FILE *  out  ) 

Create a new logger.

This is really only used for tests, you should use EagleLogger_Get() to get the default logger.

Parameters:
[in] out The file stream to send the error messages to.
Returns:
A new logger.
